munchlax.lib.im module¶

class munchlax.lib.im.IM(slack, im)[source]¶

Bases: munchlax.lib.object.Object

close()[source]¶

Closes the IM channel.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_history(latest='now', oldest=0, inclusive=True, count=100)[source]¶

Fetches and returns the message history for the IM.

Parameters:
  • latest (float | "now") –

    The end of time range of messages to include. This can be a float or “now” If “now” is specified then the current time is used.

    Defaults to “now”.

  • oldest (float) –

    The start of time range of messages to include.

    Defaults to 0.

  • inclusive (bool) –

    Whether or not to include messages with latest of oldest timestamps.

    Defaults to True.

  • count (int) –

    The number of messages to return, between 1 and 1000.

    Defaults to 100.
Returns:

A list of Message objects. bool: Whether or not there are more messages in the IM’s history.
Return type:

list (Message)
Raises:

SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_replies(ts)[source]¶

Fetches and returns all replies to a message within the IM.

Parameters:ts – The timestamp of the parent message to look for.
Returns:
A list of Message objects representing a message
thread.
Return type:list (Message)
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
mark(ts)[source]¶

Changes the last-read indicator in the IM for the current user.

Parameters:ts (float) – The timestamp to use when changing the last-read indicator.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
